SEARCH
Package bcu.cmp5332.librarysystem.model

Class Book

java.lang.Object
bcu.cmp5332.librarysystem.model.Book
public class Book extends Object
The Book class models a book inside of a library. The class has 6 variables, 5 of which are required to construct an instance. They are as follows:

  • id: Integer (required) - The primary key for each instance of the class. Used to search for specific instances.

  • title: String (required) - The title of the book.

  • author: String (required) - The individual who wrote the book.

  • publisher: String (required) - The individual/group who published the book.

  • publicationYear: String (required) - The year the book was first published.

  • loan: Loan - An internal variable used to point to the loan that the book is currently a part of.

It is important to remember that whilst the Book class has functionality to change the due date of the loan that it is currently a part of, you should instead fetch the loan object and change the due date using that object.

  • Constructor Details

    • Book

      public Book(int id, String title, String author, String publisher, String publicationYear)
      Create a new Book instance. The constructor initialises a Book object using the basic mandatory fields a book should have to exist in the library. Additional fields can be set after initialisation using the class's setter methods (e.g. setLoan(Loan) .
      Parameters:
      id - - The book's ID
      title - - The book's title
      author - - The book's author
      publisher - - The book's publisher
      publicationYear - - The book's publication year

    • isOnLoan

      public boolean isOnLoan()
      Check if the book is on loan. The function checks if the book has a Loan associated with it and returns the results.
      Returns:
      true if the book is on loan and false if the book is available

    • getStatus

      public String getStatus()
      Get the book status. The function returns "On loan" if the book is on loan and "Available" if the book is available.
      Returns:
      A string representing the status of the book.

    • getDueDate

      public LocalDate getDueDate()
      Get the due date of a book that is on loan.
      Returns:
      the due date of the loan.

    • getLoan

      public Loan getLoan()
      Get the book's Loan object that holds information about a book that is on loan.
      Returns:
      returns the pointer to the loan.

    • setLoan

      public void setLoan(Loan loan)
      Sets the loan parameter to a new Loan object referencing this class.
      Parameters:
      loan - - The pointer to a new Loan object

    • returnToLibrary

      public void returnToLibrary()
      Return the book to the library. This function is used to unset any loan information that exists for the book.

    • parse

      public static Book parse(String bookString)

      Turns a String into a book object, Used when loading Book Objects 

       |                        String format                        |
 +----------+------------+-------------+-----------------------+
 |  Book ID | Book Title | Book Author | Book Publication Year |
 +----------+------------+-------------+-----------------------+
 |    00    |  The Book  |    Author   |          1999         |
 +----------+------------+-------------+-----------------------+
      Parameters:
      bookString - - A string representation of a book object
      Returns:
      A book object matching the string representation
